history.content:
Last semester was the first semester --at the request of the instructor for F14 -- when the initial enrollment was set above 25.

Standard practice has been 25 seats before the waitlist kicks in which is how it is set up for SP15. It is highly unlikely that that will be changed for SP15.

children.subject:
You'll have to talk to Eric Paolos re his reasoning.

Of course, the information is posted on the schedule of classes and telebears as to what the current limit is.

 You can absolutely re-purpose your phase I units during evenings and early mornings when telebears is open.

The information about the number of people automatically accepted (25 this semester) is not available at the schedule.berkeley.edu page for CS160 or the the ScheduleBuilder page for CS160. Would it be possible to post on the EECS website and the schedule pages an explanation of CS160's enrollment policy (which is different from all the other EECS courses) and the number of people automatically accepted so it's crystal clear what the policy is? This page about CS160 (http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/Courses/Data/206.html) could be revised to include that information.

What was Eric Paulos' reasoning for setting F14's initial enrollment above 25? Is this vital information posted publicly anywhere on http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/? I'm graduating in SP15, and I basically wasted my Phase 1 on waitlisting in 160 when it wouldn't have made a difference. :(
4 upper div courses? You're almost ready to graduate! I guess that's why the requirements for EECS is low
This is just simply ridiculous. As a declared junior who has taken 4 upper div CS courses, I literally cannot sign up for any classes without being on a wait-list.

history.content:
The schedule.berkeley.edu page for CS160 and the the ScheduleBuilder page for CS160 say:
Enrollment from the waitlist for COMPSCI 160 is based on an application the instructor will distribute on or before the first day of lecture. If you are able to enroll, you are guaranteed a spot in the class, but if you are on the waitlist then your position on the waitlist will not matter. Enrollment on 10/21/14: Limit:108 Enrolled:25 Waitlist:14 Avail Seats:83
Last semester, Telebears automatically accepted the first 40 or 50 people who enrolled in the class. Right now, it's capping the number of people automatically accepted at 25. Will that number be raised to 40 or 50, or is 25 the new cap?
history.subject: CS160 Spring 2015
